intro: Calendula suffruticosa subsp. marginata, commonly known as the fringed calendula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems that are often hairy. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive fringed appearance, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental value. This subspecies is valued in horticulture for its vibrant color and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
